intro: Mesembryanthemum apiculatum, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, orange or yellow fruits that are edible and resemble small tomatoes. Mesembryanthemum apiculatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
